issue.title: Build fails on arm64: fatal error: 'asm/hwcap.h' file not found
issue.body:
```
FAILED: src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o 
/usr/bin/cc  -I/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/.build/include -O2 -pipe  -fstack-protector-strong -fno-strict-aliasing -O2 -pipe  -fstack-protector-strong -fno-strict-aliasing -fPIC -fvisibility=hidden -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wno-unused-command-line-argument -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -Wbad-function-cast -Wcast-qual -Wnarrowing -Wconversion -std=gnu11 -MD -MT src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o -MF src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o.d -o src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o -c /wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-0.7.1/src/common/common.c
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-0.7.1/src/common/common.c:96:10: fatal error: 'asm/hwcap.h' file not found
#include <asm/hwcap.h>
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

OS: FreeBSD 13

comment.body: I do recall issues with SIKE on "surprising" platforms in Debian, but `arm64` should work, right , @christianpaquin? @Martyrshot : Do you mind sharing (via draft PR) what you did (as well as the error messages)? Maybe more eyes have an idea how to resolve this...

issue.title: Adding aarch64 CPU feature detection for FreeBSD
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
This PR adds aarch64 CPU feature detection support when compiling for FreeBSD.
<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body:
Currently there is a linking problem with SIKE asm. My guess is that it isn't *exclusively* SIKE that is having the problem, it's just the first point of failure and thus is stopping compilation.

Note, in order to build on FreeBSD 13, there needs to be some type casts added to tests/ds_benchmark.h. It looks like the port that gets built on FreeBSD accounts for this, so I didn't push the change to this PR. I can if others think it's a good idea.

In order to build the version being discussed in #1208 do the the following:

liboqs dependencies:
```
pkg install git python3 openssl py38-pytest py38-pytest-xdist gcc astyle-3.1_3 ninja-1.10.2,2 unzip libxslt-1.1.35_2 doxygen-1.9.3,2 graphviz-2.50.0_1 py38-yaml-5.4.1 cmake-3.22.2
```

Fetch ports:
```
portsnap fetch
portsnap extract
```

Build:
```
cd /usr/ports/security/liboqs
```
comment out line 13 in `Makefile`
```
make
```
This will fail with the issue described in #1208, but will make a `work/` directory. 
```
cd work/liboqs-0.7.1
git checkout jg-freebsd-cpu-features
cd ../.build && ninja
```

Current compilation error output: 

```
[1/19] Linking C executable tests/test_kem
FAILED: tests/test_kem
```

issue.title: Build fails on arm64: fatal error: 'asm/hwcap.h' file not found
issue.body:
```
FAILED: src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o 
/usr/bin/cc  -I/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/.build/include -O2 -pipe  -fstack-protector-strong -fno-strict-aliasing -O2 -pipe  -fstack-protector-strong -fno-strict-aliasing -fPIC -fvisibility=hidden -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wno-unused-command-line-argument -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -Wbad-function-cast -Wcast-qual -Wnarrowing -Wconversion -std=gnu11 -MD -MT src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o -MF src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o.d -o src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/common.c.o -c /wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-0.7.1/src/common/common.c
/wrkdirs/usr/ports/security/liboqs/work/liboqs-0.7.1/src/common/common.c:96:10: fatal error: 'asm/hwcap.h' file not found
#include <asm/hwcap.h>
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

OS: FreeBSD 13

issue.title: using ARMv8 Assembly for liboqs
issue.body:
I'm trying to replace NTT code with assembly using NEON and building for integration with liboqs. The implementation environment is ARMv8.2 based ubuntu environment, and the target algorithm is dilithium. However, the build does not proceed with an error about the assembly item at compile time. Looking at the error items, it seems that CMAKE does not build based on ARMv8.

Examples of error items are as follows.
[../~/asm.S : 312:12 error : invalid suffix "b" on floating constant, MOV v26.16b, v2.16b]

Are there any build options I need to modify if leveraging assemblies? I didn't find that issue in various documents including the README.txt.
![화면 캡처 2022-02-03 143728](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60723218/152288030-b1f3cd0b-968b-4d17-8321-16ce754a8f9f.jpg)

comment.body: Closing issue due to lack of activity. Please re-open if needed.

issue.title: Deal with some issues identified by clang scan-build
issue.body: In hopes of eventually closing #194, I ran clang scan-build and it found a few minor issues.  This PR deals with some of them, I'll create an issue for the rest.

comment.body:
@christianpaquin The change in SIKE comes based on the following output from scan-build:

```
In file included from /Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P610/P610_compressed.c:407:
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P610/../ec_isogeny.c:658:5: warning: Value stored to 'bit' is never read [deadcode.DeadStores]
    bit = (m[j >> LOG2RADIX] >> (j & (RADIX-1))) & 1;
    ^     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 warning generated.
[1150/2353] Building C object src/kem/sike/CMakeFiles/sike.dir/external/P434/P434_compressed.c.o
In file included from /Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P434/P434_compressed.c:406:
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P434/../ec_isogeny.c:658:5: warning: Value stored to 'bit' is never read [deadcode.DeadStores]
    bit = (m[j >> LOG2RADIX] >> (j & (RADIX-1))) & 1;
    ^     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 warning generated.
[1152/2353] Building C object src/kem/sike/CMakeFiles/sike.dir/external/P751/P751_compressed.c.o
In file included from /Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P751/P751_compressed.c:424:
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P751/../ec_isogeny.c:658:5: warning: Value stored to 'bit' is never read [deadcode.DeadStores]
    bit = (m[j >> LOG2RADIX] >> (j & (RADIX-1))) & 1;
    ^     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 warning generated.
[1159/2353] Building C object src/kem/sike/CMakeFiles/sike.dir/external/P503/P503_compressed.c.o
In file included from /Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P503/P503_compressed.c:417:
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/kem/sike/external/P503/../ec_isogeny.c:658:5: warning: Value stored to 'bit' is never read [deadcode.DeadStores]
    bit = (m[j >> LOG2RADIX] >> (j & (RADIX-1))) & 1;
    ^     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 warning generated.
```
